User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Bra Discipline application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity (matches Firebase Auth UID).

displayName.description: The user's display name, typically from a social provider like Google.

photoURL.description: The URL of the user's profile picture, typically from a social provider.

FamilyEvent.title: FamilyEvent
FamilyEvent.description: Represents a planned family connection event.

userId.description: The UID of the user who owns this event.

activity.description: The name or description of the family activity.

date.description: The scheduled date and time for the event.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the event was created.

ConnectionTask.title: ConnectionTask
ConnectionTask.description: Represents a small, repeatable task to build family connection.

userId.description: The UID of the user who owns this task.

completed.description: Whether the task has been completed.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the task was created.

Goal.title: Goal
Goal.description: Represents a user-defined goal with a deadline.

userId.description: The UID of the user who owns this goal.

description.description: A detailed description of the goal.

dueDate.description: The target completion date for the goal.

completed.description: Whether the goal has been completed.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the goal was created.

FocusRoutine.title: FocusRoutine
FocusRoutine.description: Stores a user's daily focus routine, including goals and intentions.

userId.description: The UID of the user who owns this routine entry.

date.description: The date for this routine entry (YYYY-MM-DD).

goals.description: The three main goals for the day.

completed.description: Whether the goal has been completed.

difficulty.description: Points awarded for completing this goal.

do.description: A description of what the user will do today.

dont.description: A description of what the user will NOT do today.

motivation.description: A description of what motivates the user today.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure is designed to support user authentication and data storage for the 'Bra Discipline' application. It prioritizes authorization independence and clear access patterns.

*   **/users/{userId}**:  Stores user profiles.  This enables path-based ownership, simplifying security rules (only the authenticated user can access their own profile).
*   **/users/{userId}/family_events/{eventId}**: Stores planned family events. This nested structure ensures user ownership and simplifies security rules.
*   **/users/{userId}/connection_tasks/{taskId}**: Stores family connection tasks. This subcollection also leverages path-based ownership for secure data access.
*   **/users/{userId}/goals/{goalId}**: Stores user-defined goals. This subcollection also leverages path-based ownership for secure data access.
*   **/users/{userId}/focus_routines/{routineId}**: Stores daily focus routines and goals. This subcollection uses path-based ownership for security.


**Authorization Independence:**

Authorization independence is achieved through path-based ownership for all user-related data. This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules to determine access, making rules more efficient and robust.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**

The structure supports secure `list` operations (QAPs) because all documents within a collection share the same security requirements. Listing data under a user's document is secure because the path inherently restricts access to that user's own data. The homogeneous security posture within each collection ensures that rules are not used as filters.
